properties.name: break-before
properties.value: auto | avoid | always | all | avoid-page | page | left | right | recto | verso | avoid-column | column | avoid-region | region
properties.appliesTo: block-level boxes, grid items, flex items, table row groups, table rows (but see prose)

values.name: auto
values.prose: Neither force nor forbid a break before/after the principal box.

values.name: avoid
values.prose: Avoid a break before/after the principal box.

values.name: always
values.prose: Always force a break before/after the principal box. The type of this break is that of the immediately-containing fragmentation context. For example, in a multi-column container forces a column break; in paged media not inside a multi-column container, forces a page break.

values.name: all
values.prose: Always force a break before/after the principal box. This value breaks through all containing fragmentation contexts. For example, inside a multi-column container in a region in a multi-column container in paged media, it forces simultaneously a column break in the inner multi-column container, a region break, a column break in the outer multi-column container, and a page break. It’s unclear if this value is needed.

values.name: avoid-page
values.prose: Avoid a page break before/after the principal box.

values.name: page
values.prose: Always force a page break before/after the principal box.

values.name: left
values.prose: Force one or two page breaks before/after the principal box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

values.name: right
values.prose: Force one or two page breaks before/after the principal box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

values.name: recto
values.prose: Force one or two page breaks before/after the principal box so that the next page is formatted as either a left page or a right page, whichever is second (according to the page progression) in a page spread.

values.name: verso
values.prose: Force one or two page breaks before/after the principal box so that the next page is formatted as either a left page or a right page, whichever is first (according to the page progression) in a page spread.

values.name: avoid-column
values.prose: Avoid a column break before/after the principal box.

values.name: column
values.prose: Always force a column break before/after the principal box.

values.name: avoid-region
values.prose: Avoid a region break before/after the principal box.

values.name: region
values.prose: Always force a region break before/after the principal box.

properties.name: break-inside
properties.appliesTo: all elements except inline-level boxes, internal ruby boxes, table column boxes, table column group boxes, absolutely-positioned boxes

values.name: auto
values.prose: Impose no additional breaking constraints within the box.

values.name: avoid
values.prose: Avoid breaks within the box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.prose: Avoid a page break within the box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.prose: Avoid a column break within the box.

values.name: avoid-region
values.prose: Avoid a region break within the box.

properties.name: orphans
properties.appliesTo: block containers that establish an inline formatting context

properties.name: widows
properties.appliesTo: block containers that establish an inline formatting context

values.name: auto
values.prose: When an unforced break occurs before or after the box, any margins adjoining the break truncate to the remaining fragmentainer extent before the break, and are truncated to zero after the break. When a forced break occurs there, adjoining margins before the break are truncated, but margins after the break are preserved. Cloned margins are always truncated to zero.

values.name: keep
values.prose: Margins adjoining a fragmentation break are not truncated.

values.name: discard
values.prose: Margins adjoining a fragmentation break are always truncated, including at the start and end of a fragmentation context.

values.name: clone
values.prose: Each box fragment is independently wrapped with the border, padding, and margin. The border-radius and border-image and box-shadow, if any, are applied to each fragment independently. The background is drawn independently in each fragment of the element. A no-repeat background image will thus be rendered once in each fragment of the element.

values.name: slice
values.prose: The effect is as though the element were rendered with no breaks present, and then sliced by the breaks afterward: no border and no padding are inserted at a break; no box-shadow is drawn at a broken edge; and backgrounds, border-radius, and the border-image are applied to the geometry of the whole box as if it were unbroken.

warnings.name: auto
warnings.prose: Impose no additional breaking constraints within the box.

warnings.name: avoid-page
warnings.prose: Avoid a page break within the box.

warnings.name: avoid-column
warnings.prose: Avoid a column break within the box.

warnings.name: avoid-region
warnings.prose: Avoid a region break within the box.
